description: Triangle of coefficients in expansion of (1+4x)^n.
comments: T(n,k) equals the number of n-length words on {0,1,2,3,4} having n-k zeros. - _Milan Janjic_, Jul 24 2015
links: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
formula: G.f.: 1 / (1 - x(1+4y)).T(n,k) = 4^k*C(n,k) = Sum_{i=n-k..n} C(i,n-k)*C(n,i)*3^(n-i). Row sums are 5^n = A000351. - _Mircea Merca_, Apr 28 2012
maple: T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, x, k), k=0..n))((1+4*x)^n):seq(T(n), n=0..10);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Jul 24 2015
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
